name: 3dToyProg
author: AFNI (Analysis of Functional NeuroImages) Development Team
description: A program to illustrate dataset creation and manipulation in C using AFNI's API.

inputs.description: Restrict analysis to non-zero voxels in the mask dataset
inputs.name: Mask dataset

inputs.description: Output datum type for one of the datasets. Choose from 'float' or 'short'. Default is 'float'.
inputs.name: Output datum type

inputs.description: Mini help, at time, same as -help in many cases.
inputs.name: Mini help flag

inputs.description: Extreme help, same as -help in majority of cases.
inputs.name: Extreme help flag

inputs.description: Open help in text editor. AFNI will try to find a GUI editor on your machine. You can control which it should use by setting environment variable AFNI_GUI_EDITOR.
inputs.name: Help view flag

inputs.description: Open help in web browser. AFNI will try to find a browser on your machine. You can control which it should use by setting environment variable AFNI_GUI_EDITOR.
inputs.name: Help web flag

inputs.description: Look for lines in this program's -help output that match (approximately) WORD.
inputs.name: Help find flag

inputs.description: Help string in sphinx loveliness, but do not try to autoformat.
inputs.name: Help sphinx flag

inputs.description: Help string in sphinx with autoformatting of options, etc.
inputs.name: Help autoformat sphinx flag

inputs.description: Try to identify all options for the program from the output of its -help option. Some options might be missed and others misidentified. Use this output for hints only.
inputs.name: All options flag
